title: Fix AI response logic to stop echoing user input

requirements.text: Fix the backend AI response logic so that when a user sends a message, the assistant returns a meaningful, contextually relevant response instead of echoing or copying the user's input back to them. The simulated AI should produce varied, helpful replies appropriate to a gaming assistant context (e.g., tips, suggestions, answers to gaming questions) rather than repeating what the user typed.

quotes: When i command it to do something it just copies me
Can you make it do what i whant

acceptanceCriteria: Sending any message to the AI never results in a response that simply repeats or mirrors the user's input verbatim.
The AI returns a distinct, meaningful reply for common gaming-related inputs (e.g., asking for tips, game recommendations, or help with a specific game).
The AI response varies based on the content of the user's message rather than always returning a generic or copied reply.
Conversation history continues to be stored correctly with both user and assistant messages.
The typing indicator still appears while the response is being generated.

constraints: Do not change the existing conversation history data model or backend storage schema.
Do not modify any immutable frontend paths (hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, hooks/useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui).
Preserve the existing futuristic dark-mode visual theme and neon styling.
nonGoals: Integrating a real external AI/LLM API.
Adding new UI features or redesigning the chat interface.
